column2: SOUTH CAROLINA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: South Carolina
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian.
column6: to the pedestrian.
column8: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: Open intersection ahead
column6: Traffic signal ahead
column8: No traffic signal ahead

column2: 3. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column6: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column8: Never.

column2: 4. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling toward you:
column4: signal the emergency vehicle that they can pass you.
column6: make every effort to give them a clear path of travel.
column8: increase you speed until you reach the next intersection, then let the emergency vehicle pass.

column2: 5. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Anti-Braking System
column6: Anti-Locking Brake System
column8: Average-Beam System

column2: 6. To give yourself a 3 to 4 second following distance from the vehicle ahead of you:
column4: count the seconds it takes the vehicle ahead of you to reach the point you are at.
column6: pass a stationary object and count how many seconds it takes the vehicle ahead to do the same.
column8: watch as the vehicle ahead passes a stationary object and count the seconds it takes you to reach that same point.

column2: 7. When driving in fog, you should use your high beam headlights.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 8. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 9. When is it illegal to pass another vehicle?
column4: On a hill or curve.
column6: At highway intersections.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 10. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Brake early and gently.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 11. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column8: Pedestrians may turn right.

column2: 12. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Remain calm and relaxed.
column6: Try to move away safely.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 13. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 14. When entering and starting a parked vehicle, you should:
column4: in heavy traffic, tell other drivers to stop so you may enter the vehicle.
column6: before you enter the vehicle, look around for obstacles that may interfere with safe driving.
column8: back up slowly, then enter the vehicle.

column2: 15. It is against the law to:
column4: pass a school bus with flashing red lights and the stop sign arm extended.
column6: go around lowered railroad gates at a crossing.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 16. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 17. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: has the right-of-way.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 18. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: in school zones.
column6: on multiple lane highways.
column8: at most intersections.

column2: 19. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: move to another lane if possible.
column6: activate your stop lights.
column8: brake suddenly.

column2: 20. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column6: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.

column2: 21. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: warn drivers.
column6: guide drivers.
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 22. When driving in fog, you should:
column4: Increase your speed to avoid causing an accident.
column6: Turn on your high beam headlights.
column8: Slow down and use your low beam headlights. If fog is heavy, pull off road and stop.

column2: 23. The picture shows:
column4: a railroad advance warning sign.
column6: a speeding fines doubled sign.
column8: a reversible road sign.

column2: 24. Drinking alcohol and/or using drugs affects:
column4: your coordination.
column6: your judgement.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 25. When the road is slippery you should:
column4: decrease the following distance.
column6: check your brakes.
column8: slow and pro-ceed with caution.

column2: 26. To see objects in your blind spot when changing lanes, drivers should check:
column4: only the inside rearview mirror.
column6: over the left or right shoulder.
column8: only the left outside mirror.

column2: 27. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column6: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
column8: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

column2: 28. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column6: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

column2: 29. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 30. At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow:
column4: after making a complete stop first.
column6: if you are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
column8: if you wait until the light changes.
